page.title: 03THE RIVER WYE
page.content: The River Wye is well known for its beauty and has been a source of inspiration to poets through the ages.This stretch of the river forms part of the Lower Wye Valley which has been designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It has its source in the Cambrian Mountains,close to the source of the River Severn,and after many miles of meandering through beautiful countryside flows into the Severn Estuary at Chepstow,approximately four miles south of Tintern. The Wye is tidal from the Severn, through this area,to Brockweir Bridge just to the north.It was once navigable to trading ships,when the area was industrial,but is now used only by pleasure craft and for fishing,particularly salmon and elver.
